alert.note: Alert for Thurston (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 07 at 6:32AM PST until January 08 at 2:28AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Deschutes River Near Rainier affecting Thurston County. .Heavy rain, both in the lowlands and the mountains, combined with lowland snowmelt pushed the Deschutes River near Rainier above flood stage Thursday. The river has crested and will continue receding today. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Deschutes River Near Rainier. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, the Deschutes River will flood downstream in Tumwater Valley including the golf course. Minor flooding will also occur in several residential areas...mainly Cougar Mountain and Driftwood Valley. Many roads and farm lands will also be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 AM PST Friday the stage was 12.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 AM PST Friday was 13.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling receding tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 230 PM PST.
